<title level="1" right="Rules">[Darkness](/Rules.aspx?ID=2404)</title>

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 432 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
A creature or object within darkness is [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=79) or [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=96) unless the seeker has [darkvision](/Rules.aspx?ID=2410) or a [precise sense](/Rules.aspx?ID=2406) other than vision. A creature without darkvision or another means of perceiving in darkness has the [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=59) condition while in darkness, though it might be able to see illuminated areas beyond the darkness. If a creature can see into an illuminated area, it can observe creatures within that illuminated area normally. After being in darkness, sudden exposure to bright light might make you [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=65) for a short time, as determined by the GM.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
